key_points: CNN has fired anchor Chris Cuomo for trying to help his brother, former New York governor Andrew Cuomo, combat sexual misconduct accusations.
CNN announced the firing after citing 'additional information' had come to light regarding Cuomo's involvement.
A respected law firm was hired by CNN to conduct the review leading to Chris Cuomo's termination.
Chris Cuomo expressed his disappointment over the firing but said he was proud of his team's work.
Chris Cuomo had previously been suspended on Tuesday before his eventual firing.
Documentation released during the investigation into Andrew Cuomo showed Chris Cuomo's active involvement in his brother's defense.
Chris Cuomo reportedly pressed sources for information on his brother's accusers and helped shape responses to the charges.
He has stated he never tried to influence CNN's coverage of his brother and never attacked any woman who came forward.
Veteran TV executive Shelley Ross claimed Chris Cuomo groped her 16 years ago, which Cuomo has apologized for.
Victims' rights advocates and alleged victims of Andrew Cuomo's misconduct called for CNN to fire Chris Cuomo prior to his termination.
